channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: IRS law enforcement expanded reach in 2025: Helped ICE, policed D.C. streets
item.description: Nearly a century ago, the IRS' criminal investigators built the case that landed Al Capone behind bars for tax evasion.

item.title: ‘But Your iPhone’ Conservatism Will Fail
item.description: We must acknowledge that the badges of middle-class life have become harder to achieve, no matter our technological advances.

item.title: A SpaceX IPO could be the largest public offering of all time—and Elon Musk’s biggest headache
item.description: Musk’s space company had avoided much of the scrutiny, criticism, and regulatory burden that comes with going public.

item.title: Vance tells blue state they ‘might try hiring Americans’ before suing over Trump’s visa fee explosion
item.description: VP JD Vance clashes with Oregon attorney general over Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee as 19 states file lawsuit challenging the policy as excessive.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley said Trump would halve the EV market by ending subsidies. Now he’s writing down $19.5 billion amid a ‘customer-driven’ shift
item.description: Months ago Farley said the EV market would shrink to 5% of the U.S. vehicle market.

item.title: IBM, AWS veteran says 90% of your employees are stuck in first gear with AI, just asking it to ‘write their mean email in a slightly more polite way’
item.description: Using AI as a “teammate” unlocks the true potential of AI productivity, according to Open Machine CEO Allie K. Miller.
